column1: Where exactly is Ilora Retreats located?
column2: Ilora Retreats is situated in the central Olkiombo area of the Masai Mara National Reserve in Kenya, offering a prime location for wildlife viewing. We are conveniently located close to Rhino Ridge and just a short distance from the Olkiombo Airstrip. "How large is the property?"
column3: The retreat is set on a sprawling 30 acres of land within the heart of the Masai Mara, providing ample space, privacy, and a deep connection with nature for all our guests. "What is the distance between the tents?"
column4: To ensure maximum privacy and seclusion for our guests, each of our luxury tents is spaced approximately 70 feet apart from the next, allowing for a quiet and intimate experience. "How do I get to the camp from Nairobi by air?"
column5: The most convenient route is a 45-minute flight from Nairobi (Wilson Airport) to Olkiombo Airstrip. From the airstrip, our team will meet you for a short 7-minute transfer directly to the camp. "Can I drive to the camp from Nairobi?"
column6: Yes, guests can choose to drive from Nairobi to the Masai Mara. The journey by road takes approximately 6.5 hours and offers a scenic route through the Great Rift Valley. "How long is the transfer from the airstrip to the camp?"
column7: The transfer from Olkiombo Airstrip to Ilora Retreats is very quick and convenient, taking only about 7 minutes by vehicle, meaning you can start your safari experience almost immediately upon landing. "Is the camp fenced?"
column8: As an authentic bush camp designed to blend with nature, we are unfenced to allow wildlife to move freely through the area. However, we have strict safety protocols and security escorts available to ensure your safety at all times. "What is the altitude of the camp?"
column9: The Masai Mara is situated at an altitude ranging from 1,500 to 2,170 meters above sea level. This elevation contributes to the pleasant, temperate climate that guests enjoy year-round. "What kind of weather can I expect?"
column10: The climate is generally pleasant and mild. From June to October, temperatures typically range between 18°C and 24°C. December to February is slightly warmer, ranging from 22°C to 28°C, while March to May typically sees sporadic rains. "Is Ilora Retreats eco-friendly?"
column11: Yes, we are deeply committed to sustainability. The entire camp is powered by a 100 KWH solar setup, we use no single-use plastics, and our amenities are organic and eco-friendly to minimize our environmental footprint. "What wildlife might I see near the camp?"
column12: Our location is excellent for wildlife viewing right from the property. We have a resident leopard named Bahati who is often spotted nearby, and a hippo pool is located right along the boundary of the camp. "Is there internet or WiFi connectivity?"
column13: Yes, we understand the need to stay connected. Complimentary WiFi is available throughout the camp, including inside the tents and in common areas. "What is the WiFi password?"
column14: The current WiFi password for the guest network is Bahati@2025. If you have any trouble connecting, please ask a staff member for assistance. "Does the camp have mobile phone reception?"
column15: Mobile reception can be intermittent due to our remote location in the reserve. However, our WiFi ensures you can easily make calls via WhatsApp or WiFi calling apps. "What are the check-in and check-out times?"
column16: Our standard check-in time is 1:00 PM, allowing you time to settle in before lunch. Check-out time is 11:00 AM. Early check-in or late check-out requests are subject to availability. "Is the camp open year-round?"
column17: Yes, Ilora Retreats welcomes guests throughout the year. Each season offering unique wildlife experiences, from the Great Migration in peak season to the lush landscapes of the Green Season. "What happens upon arrival at the camp?"
column18: Upon arrival, guests are warmly greeted with our signature 'Flute Welcome' drink. You are also invited to participate in a traditional tree-planting ceremony to commemorate your stay and contribute to local conservation. "What is the departure ceremony?"
column19: As a fond farewell, our entire team gathers to perform a 'Guard of Honour' for departing guests, wishing them a safe journey home and hoping for their return. "Are there medical facilities nearby?"
column20: We have a trained paramedic on-site at the camp, equipped with first aid and essential medicines to handle minor medical needs and stabilize emergencies. "Is the water safe to drink?"
column21: Yes, your health is our priority. We provide unlimited complimentary RO (Reverse Osmosis) bottled water for drinking. Additionally, the water in the taps and showers is RO treated and safe for use.

column1: How many rooms does the retreat have?
column2: Ilora Retreats features an exclusive collection of just 14 luxury tents. This intimate number ensures a personalized and private experience for every guest. "What is the size of the tents?"
column3: Each of our luxury tents is incredibly spacious, covering an area of 700 square feet. They are designed to offer ample living space, comfort, and elegance in the heart of the bush. "What occupancy types are available?"
column4: Our tents are available in Twin or Double occupancy configurations to suit your needs. We can also arrange for an extra bed or child cot on request for families. "Do the tents have electricity?"
column5: Yes, despite our remote location, all tents have reliable 24-hour electricity powered by our solar plant. You will find universal plugs and USB charging points for all your devices. "Are the tents air-conditioned?"
column6: Due to the pleasant, temperate climate of the Mara and our eco-friendly design, tents are not air-conditioned. However, they are well-ventilated and equipped with ceiling fans for your comfort. "Is there a safe in the room for valuables?"
column7: Yes, peace of mind is important. Every tent is equipped with a digital in-room safe for your valuables. The default code is 1234, but we recommend you set a personal code upon arrival. "How do I operate the in-room locker?"
column8: Operating the safe is simple. To lock it, close the door, enter your chosen 3-to-6 digit code, and press 'L'. To open it, simply enter the same code again. Instructions are also available in your room. "What happens if I forget my locker code?"
column9: If you forget your code or the locker remains locked, please do not worry or try to force it open. Simply contact the Duty Manager or Security, and they will assist you immediately. "Are there refrigerators in the rooms?"
column10: Yes, each tent features an eco-friendly, electricity-free fridge. This innovative design keeps beverages 10-15 degrees cooler than the outside temperature without using power. "Do you offer a pillow menu?"
column11: Absolutely. We believe a good night's sleep is essential. We offer a Pillow Menu including Memory Foam, Latex, and Anti-Snoring pillows so you can choose your perfect match. "What is the benefit of the Memory Foam pillow?"
column12: Our Memory Foam pillow is designed to mold to the unique shape of your head and neck. This provides personalized support and helps relieve pressure points for a restful sleep. "Who should use the Latex Pillow?"
column13: The Latex Pillow is an excellent choice for those who prefer firm support for their head and neck. It is versatile and suitable for all sleeping positions. "How does the Anti-Snoring pillow work?"
column14: This pillow is specially shaped to improve head and neck alignment during sleep. This helps keep airways open and may effectively reduce snoring for better sleep quality. "Are there hair dryers in the rooms?"
column15: Yes, we provide premium hair dryers in every tent for your convenience, so you don't need to pack one. "What toiletries are provided?"
column16: We provide a curated range of organic, eco-friendly toiletries in your en-suite bathroom, including shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotion. "Is there a telephone in the room?"
column17: Yes, each tent has an intercom phone for your convenience. You can dial specific extensions to reach Housekeeping, the Restaurant, the Spa, or the Duty Manager at any time. "How do I call Housekeeping?"
column18: You can reach our Housekeeping team by dialing extension 2 from your room phone. They are available to assist with laundry, water refills, or room cleaning requests. "How do I contact Security or request an escort?"
column19: Your safety is paramount. For security assistance or to request a night escort to or from your tent, please dial extension 5. "Are there mosquito nets?"
column20: Instead of traditional nets, our tents are fully sealed to prevent insects from entering. We also perform mosquito control spraying during turndown service and provide repellents for your use. "Is there a private veranda?"
column21: Yes, every tent features a spacious private veranda. It is the perfect spot to relax, sip a coffee, and enjoy the stunning views of the savannah in complete privacy. "Is laundry service available?"
column22: Yes, we offer laundry services to freshen up your safari gear. Guests on certain packages may have complimentary laundry (up to 5 pieces per person per day), otherwise, it is charged per piece.

column2: We offer a variety of dining experiences. You can dine in our Main Dining Tent, enjoy al fresco meals at the Poolside, relax at the Sky Deck, or experience our signature Bush Breakfasts and Dinners in the wild. "What type of cuisine is served?"
column3: Our culinary team serves a curated 5-course plated menu. It features a delightful blend of Italian, European, Middle Eastern, Indian, and Chinese cuisines, all prepared by Michelin-trained chefs. "Do you cater to dietary restrictions?"
column4: Yes, we take dietary requirements seriously. We can cater to vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, and kosher meals (please note that kosher meals require a prior request to ensure availability). "What are the meal timings?"
column5: Our meal service is designed around your safari schedule. Breakfast is served from 7:00 AM to 9:00 AM, Lunch from 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM, and Dinner from 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM. "Is there a bar on the property?"
column6: Yes, 'Bahati’s Lounge' is our welcoming open bar. It offers a wide selection of fine wines, spirits, cocktails, and soft drinks for you to enjoy. "What beverages are complimentary?"
column7: For guests booked on the Game Package, house wines, beers, soft drinks, and selected spirits are included. Premium labels and champagne are available for an additional charge. "What coffee options do you have?"
column8: Our Coffee House menu is extensive. It includes Single/Double Espresso, Americano, Mocha, Café Latte, Cappuccino, Macchiato, and French Press. We also serve refreshing Iced Coffee. "What teas are available?"
column9: We offer a variety of fine teas to suit every taste, including Hibiscus, Chamomile, English Breakfast, Green Tea, Earl Grey, Darjeeling, Masala Tea, and Jasmine Tea. "Can I get coffee early in the morning?"
column10: Yes, absolutely. Our tea and coffee service is available from 5:00 AM to 10:00 PM, which is perfect for an early start before your morning game drive. "What cocktails do you recommend?"
column11: Our bar serves excellent cocktails. We recommend classics like the 'Dawa' (Vodka & Honey), 'Margarita', 'Mojito', 'Whiskey Sour', 'Gin & Tonic', and 'Long Island Iced Tea'. "How much are cocktails for non-package guests?"
column12: For guests not on the all-inclusive package, most of our signature cocktails, such as the Dawa, Mojito, and Margarita, are priced at $12 each. "Do you have non-alcoholic cocktails?"
column13: Yes, we have a delicious 'Mocktails' menu. It features refreshing drinks like the Virgin Mojito, Virgin Colada, Shirley Temple, and Passion Mojito, all priced at $11. "What soft drinks are available?"
column14: We stock a full range of soft drinks including Coke, Coke Zero, Sprite, Fanta, Ginger Ale, Bitter Lemon, Soda Water, and Tonic Water. These are $3 each for non-package guests. "Do you serve fresh juices?"
column15: Yes, we offer freshly squeezed Apple, Orange, Pineapple, Mango, and Passion fruit juices, priced at $6 per glass for a refreshing boost. "Is there a corkage fee?"
column16: If you wish to bring your own special bottle to enjoy in the common areas, there is a corkage fee of $25 per bottle. However, consumption in the privacy of your room is free of charge. "Can I have a private bush dinner?"
column17: Absolutely. We can organize a magical candlelit Bush Dinner under the stars for a romantic and unforgettable dining experience surrounded by nature. "What is a 'Sundowner'?"
column18: A Sundowner is a quintessential safari tradition. It involves enjoying drinks and snacks at a scenic spot in the bush while watching the sunset over the vast savannah. "Are packed meals available for safaris?"
column19: Yes, if you plan to be out on a game drive all day to maximize wildlife viewing, we can provide packed picnic breakfasts or lunches upon request. "How do I order room service?"
column20: For room service orders or any restaurant inquiries, simply dial extension 3 from your tent's telephone and our team will be happy to assist. "Is the water used for ice safe?"
column21: Yes, you can consume drinks with confidence. All ice and drinking water served at the retreat is prepared using purified RO-treated water and is perfectly safe.

column1: Does the retreat have a spa?
column2: Yes, our 'Spa in the Wild' offers a range of rejuvenating treatments in a serene setting. We use premium Theravine products to ensure a luxurious experience. "What are the spa operating hours?"
column3: The spa is generally available during the day. We highly recommend booking your treatment in advance to secure your preferred time slot. "How much is a full body massage?"
column4: Our 60-minute Holistic Full Body Massage is priced at $90, and the longer 90-minute session is available for $120 for extended relaxation. "Do you offer deep tissue massage?"
column5: Yes, we offer a Deep Tissue Massage which is excellent for muscle recovery after a long game drive. It costs $100 for 60 minutes or $130 for 90 minutes. "Are there treatments for couples?"
column6: While our menu lists individual prices, we are happy to arrange treatments for couples. Please ask the spa team for availability and we will do our best to accommodate you. "What facial treatments are available?"
column7: We offer a 'Hydrating Facial' using high-quality Theravine products. It is designed to rehydrate and refresh your skin after exposure to the sun and dust, lasting 60 minutes for $80. "Do you have a gym on site?"
column8: Yes, for fitness enthusiasts, we have a 'Gym in the Wild'. It is equipped with essential fitness equipment so you can maintain your workout routine while enjoying the views of nature. "Is there a swimming pool?"
column9: Yes, we feature a beautiful swimming pool perfect for cooling off. It includes a dedicated kid-friendly section and a 'Pool Serenity' area for relaxation. "Do you offer yoga classes?"
column10: Yes, we offer 'Sunrise Yoga' sessions as part of our Morning Magic activities. It is a wonderful way to start your day with mindfulness in the peaceful bush setting. "Can I get a manicure or pedicure?"
column11: Yes, we offer a Manicure & Pedicure combo treatment that takes 60 minutes and costs $70, perfect for a bit of pampering. "What is reflexology?"
column12: Reflexology is a specialized massage focusing on pressure points in the feet to promote general well-being. We offer a 45-minute session for $70. "Do you offer body scrubs?"
column13: Yes, our 'Body Exfoliation' treatment helps remove dead skin cells and revitalize your skin, leaving it soft and smooth. It takes 45 minutes and costs $70. "How do I book a spa appointment?"
column14: Booking is easy. You can book a treatment by visiting the spa directly or by dialing extension 4 from your room phone to speak with our therapist. "What is the 'Head & Shoulder' massage?"
column15: This is a shorter, focused massage lasting 30 minutes. It targets tension in the upper body and is priced at $50, ideal for a quick relaxation session. "Is the pool heated?"
column16: Our pool is not heated, but it offers a refreshing and welcome break from the midday heat of the Mara, allowing you to cool down comfortably. "Are towels provided at the pool?"
column17: Yes, fresh, fluffy towels are provided at the pool area for your convenience, so there is no need to bring one from your room. "Can children use the spa?"
column18: Spa treatments are generally designed for adults. However, please consult with the spa manager regarding any suitable options or modifications for younger guests. "Where is the spa located?"
column19: The spa is located in a quiet, secluded area of the camp. This location was chosen to ensure maximum peace and tranquility during your treatments. "What products do you use in the spa?"
column20: We exclusively use 'Theravine', a premium brand known for its high-quality, grape-derived spa products that are rich in antioxidants and gentle on the skin. "Is there a relaxation area in the spa?"
column21: Yes, the spa is designed as a sanctuary. It features spaces where you can relax and unwind before and after your treatment to fully absorb the benefits.

column1: What activities are available in the morning?
column2: Our 'Morning Magic' program features a range of options. You can enjoy sunrise yoga, join a guided bush walk, or embark on a morning safari drive to catch wildlife when they are most active. "What can I do during the mid-morning?"
column3: Mid-morning offers engaging cultural and culinary activities. You can join a 'Farm to Table' experience, try 'Koroga' (cooking with the chef), participate in beadwork with local women, or try Maasai spear throwing. "What happens in the afternoon?"
column4: Afternoons are relaxed and educational. They are perfect for joining photography classes at our lounge, visiting a local Maasai village to learn about their culture, or visiting a nearby school. "What evening activities do you offer?"
column5: 'Evenings in the Wild' are magical. They feature late afternoon safari drives, sundowners, bonfires, 'Bush Flix' (our outdoor movie experience), and fascinating ranger storytelling sessions. "What is 'Celestial Nights'?"
column6: 'Celestial Nights' is a unique nocturnal experience. Guests can enjoy stargazing from our Sky Deck or even choose to sleep under the vast African sky in our specialized 'Star Bed'. "Tell me about the Photo Lounge."
column7: The Photo Lounge is a dedicated studio for photographers. It features two Mac Minis with M4 chips, Dell Ultra-Sharp monitors, and professional editing software like Lightroom and Photoshop to edit your safari photos. "Is the Photo Lounge free to use?"
column8: Yes, the use of the Photo Lounge workstations and all installed software is complimentary for our guests, allowing you to edit and share your memories without extra cost. "What software is installed in the Photo Lounge?"
column9: We have a full suite of professional software installed, including Adobe Photoshop, Lightroom Classic, Premiere Pro, After Effects, DaVinci Resolve, Topaz AI, and more. "Can I transfer my photos to a drive?"
column10: Yes, we provide multi-card readers compatible with SD, CF, and XQD cards. We also sell USB-A flash drives if you need extra storage for your files. "Do you offer game drives?"
column11: Yes, we offer professionally guided game drives. These are conducted in private 4x4 Landcruisers, ensuring a comfortable and exclusive way to explore the Masai Mara. "Can I book a hot air balloon safari?"
column12: Yes, we can arrange a spectacular hot air balloon safari. This experience offers a breathtaking aerial view of the Mara at sunrise, followed by a champagne breakfast (additional cost applies). "What cultural experiences are available?"
column13: We offer immersive cultural experiences including visits to traditional Maasai villages, visits to local schools, and evening Maasai dance performances at the camp. "Is there a shop on the property?"
column14: Yes, we have a Curio Shop on-site. It sells a variety of handicrafts, jewelry, t-shirts, and memory cards, with many items made by local Maasai communities. "What is 'Bush Flix'?"
column15: Bush Flix is our unique outdoor cinema experience. You can watch classic movies under the stars, surrounded by the sounds of the bush, for a memorable evening. "Can I learn photography at the camp?"
column16: Yes, we offer photography classes in the afternoons. These sessions utilize our state-of-the-art Photo Lounge equipment and can help you improve your wildlife photography skills. "Do you have binoculars?"
column17: Yes, we understand they are essential for safari. Binoculars are available to be borrowed from the reception for use during your game drives. "What is the 'Tree Planting' ceremony?"
column18: It is a sustainability initiative we are proud of. Guests are invited to plant a tree upon arrival, leaving a positive, lasting mark on the Mara ecosystem. "Are walking safaris safe?"
column19: Yes, safety is our priority. Our walking safaris are conducted by experienced guides and rangers who ensure your safety while you explore the flora and fauna on foot. "Can kids participate in activities?"
column20: Yes, we welcome families. We have a kid-friendly section in the pool, and many activities like beadwork, school visits, and spear throwing are great for children. "How do I book activities?"
column21: Booking is simple. You can book activities through the Duty Manager (extension 7) or directly with your Driver/Guide (extension 6).

column2: We accept both US Dollars and Kenyan Shillings. For your convenience, major credit cards are also accepted for payments at the camp. "What are the park fees?"
column3: Park fees vary by season. From July 2025 to December 2025, park fees are $200 per adult per day. From January to June 2025, they are $100 per adult per day. Children pay 50% of the adult rate. "What is the child policy?"
column4: Children aged 0-6 years stay free of charge. Children aged 7-12 years pay 50% of the adult rate. Children above 12 years are charged as adults. "What is the cancellation policy?"
column5: Bookings cancelled 61+ days prior incur no penalty. Cancellations 60-46 days out incur 20%. 45-31 days out incur 50%. Cancellations within 30 days are charged at 100%. "Do I need travel insurance?"
column6: We strongly recommend that all guests have comprehensive travel insurance. This should include medical evacuation cover, as park fees and accommodation costs are often non-refundable. "How do I provide feedback?"
column7: We value your feedback. You can scan the QR code found on our TripAdvisor flyer to leave a review. Your input helps us recognize our staff and improve our service. "What are the contact numbers for the camp?"
column8: The camp's direct number is +254 714 543 506. The Nairobi office can also be reached at the same number: +254 714 543 506. "Who should I contact for a medical emergency?"
column9: In case of a medical emergency, please contact the Duty Manager immediately by dialing extension 7 or Security at extension 5. We have a paramedic on site to assist. "Is there a limit on luggage?"
column10: Yes, if flying to the Mara, local airlines typically have a strict luggage limit of 15kg per person, including hand luggage. Please use soft bags as hard-shell suitcases may not fit. "Can I pay for extras with a credit card?"
column11: Yes, Visa and Mastercard are generally accepted at the camp for incidental charges like purchases from the Curio Shop or premium drinks. "Are park fees included in the rate?"
column12: No, please note that park fees are mandatory and payable directly. They are not included in the standard accommodation rates unless specified in your package. "What defines a 'Group' booking?"
column13: A booking is considered a group booking if it involves 7 or more tents. Please note that different payment terms and conditions apply to group reservations. "When is the festive season?"
column14: The Festive Season runs from 24th December to 1st January. During this period, a supplement fee applies per person per night due to high demand. "How do I contact the Driver/Guide?"
column15: You can reach the Driver/Guide station directly by dialing extension 6 from your room phone to discuss game drive timings or plans. "What is the 'Green Season'?"
column16: The Green Season is from 1st April to 31st May. This season features lush landscapes and often has the most attractive rates for staying at the retreat. "Do you have a Single Room supplement?"
column17: Yes, a Single Room Supplement usually applies. However, it is waived for the first two single rooms booked during the Green and Mid seasons. "Is a deposit required for booking?"
column18: Yes, to confirm a booking, a 20% deposit is required. The remaining balance is due 45 days prior to your arrival date. "What is the policy for provisional bookings?"
column19: Provisional bookings can be held for 14 days. If they are not confirmed with a deposit within this time, they may be released automatically to other guests. "Are drones allowed?"
column20: Drone usage is strictly regulated in the Masai Mara to protect wildlife and privacy. It is generally not allowed without special permits from the authorities. "How do I contact the Spa?"
column21: To book a treatment or make an inquiry, please dial extension 4 from your tent to speak directly with the Spa team. "How do I contact the Duty Manager?"
column22: For any general queries, complaints, or special requests during your stay, please dial extension 7 to reach the Duty Manager.
